settings.title: LIVING WATER AERATION FOR ALL POND FOUNTAIN AND AERATOR NEEDS
Let us Help You Bring New Life to Your Pond
settings.bigText: Having trouble finding just the right thing for your pond or lake? No problem sign up here and one of our pond experts will call you for a free consultation.

settings.title: Perfect Your Pond in 2021
settings.bigText: Click below to reach out to a pond expert to help you find the perfect equipment and tools for your unique pond!

settings.video_desc:
Here in the resource center, we want to help you create the best pond possible! Below you will
find a variety of videos, articles, and FAQs that will help you feel confident to create a healthy
pond. Enter your email below to stay up to date on the best practices!

settings.our_desc: Are you looking to install an aerator or fountain in your pond to improve the water quality?
Are you looking to enjoy the sight and sound of a fountain while helping improve your pond water?
Are you looking to clean up your pond by clarifying the water and minimize muck and algae?
Are you looking to beautify your pond and help create a better environment for your fish?
Are you looking to install an aerator or fountain in your pond to improve the water quality?
Are you looking to enjoy the sight and sound of a fountain while helping improve your pond water?
Are you looking to clean up your pond by clarifying the water and minimize muck and algae?
Are you looking to beautify your pond and help create a better environment for your fish?

settings.video_desc:
Fountains can aerate and add a beautiful ascetic feature while providing a great vital resource for
the ecosystem of your pond. While optimal for shallow ponds, these fountains will provide a
soothing sound and help with the overall water quality. Below we have questions past customers
have asked, blogs on specific topics, and videos regarding fountains!

settings.question: How deep can fountains aerate ponds?
settings.answer: It does add oxygen to ponds up to about 6 feet deep. If your pond is deeper than 6 feet you may want to consider diffused aeration (bottom aeration). However if your pond is 6 foot or less you can use a fountain style aerator to aerate the entire thing.

settings.question: Which size fountain should I buy for my pond?
settings.answer: The general rule of thumb when sizing these for a pond is 1.5 HP per acre.

settings.question: Do most fountains float?
settings.answer: Yes, most include float and mooring ropes to keep the unit in place.

settings.question: During the winter, do you need to take your fountain out of the water?
settings.answer: It depends, if it gets cold enough where you are that the pond actually ices over, then yes you will want to store it in a dry area for winter. However, in the south where ponds do not ice over you can leave them installed year round.

settings.question: My pond has a lot of floating green algae. Will a fountain have problems with the pump clogging?
settings.answer: No you will not there is a bottom screen included with all fountains for protection. Anything that gets past the screen will be shredded like paper.

settings.video_desc:
Pond Aeration is the main source for a healthy pond. An effective pond aeration system will
provide a wide range of benefits to the ecosystem of your pond, helping it thrive! Below, we
have questions past customers have asked, blogs, and videos on specific topics regarding
aeration!

settings.question: What are the main benefits of aeration?
settings.answer: The main benefits of Aeration are your fish stay healthy, eliminates excessive algae, improves pond water quality, helps with the overall destratification of your pond, reduces mosquito activity, removes foul pond smells, reduces bottom sediment, and more!

settings.question: What are the main factors when buying an aerator?
settings.answer: The four key components when buying an aerator are pond depth, pond size, and pond shape. Once you know what aerator to buy you must determine your power source and storage of the pump. This may seem overwhelming but we offer free consultation on this and have categories on our website to help with this!

settings.question: How noisy are aerator pumps?
settings.answer: The pump is not very noisy, think of hearing a box fan turned on high. If you cover the compressor with one of our cabinets that can be muffled even further. In fact if you are really concerned about the sound I recommend getting our deluxe kit and selecting the sound proofing upgrade.

settings.question: How much does it cost to run the aerator in electricity per day?
settings.answer: Aerators cost an average of $0.50 per day and that consumption is if you ran them 24/7.

settings.question: Should the compressor be installed on a pedestal? How high?
settings.answer: No that is not necessary unless the area near your pond is prone to flash flooding. A pedestal is not necessary but you will definitely want to find some type of enclosure to protect it from the elements.

settings.question: How far can a pump be from the aerator?
settings.answer: In general, You can run up to 1000' feet with no problem. It has plenty of PSI to make the run. You probably will want to consider buying a larger diameter tubing. We usually would recommend 1/2" Weighted tubing for a 500+ foot run.

settings.question: Do pumps become hot while running?
settings.answer: Yes they do run hot and they are hot to the touch, I would not recommend touching one that has been running for awhile.

settings.question: How long is the electrical cord for aerator pumps?
settings.answer: Only about 3 foot long. If you need to go further we recommend running more airline as opposed to using an extension cord

settings.question: Is the compressor waterproof and can it be placed outdoors exposed to the elements?
settings.answer: No, it is not waterproof. We recommend our deluxe unit if you do not have an enclosure for the compressor.

settings.video_desc:
Without proper aeration, ponds may develop unpleasant conditions such as algae, muck, and foul
smells, as well as become a breeding ground for mosquitoes. We have products that can help
with each of those problems! Below we have questions past customers have asked and blogs
regarding pond cleanup!

settings.question: I got an aerator, and still have algae and muck what do I do?
settings.answer: Sometimes when a pond is in bad shape (lots of muck and algae), it takes time for it to become healthy. A properly installed aerator will greatly improve water quality over time. To speed this process up we suggest Pond Boost or Muck Assault. These beneficial bacterias can help transform your pond.

settings.question: What is the main cause for muck in ponds?
settings.answer: Muck is caused from dying or decaying organics such as dead algae, twigs, grass clippings, fish waste, leaves, etc. An aeration system will circulate and disrupt the algae spores towards deeper pond areas. This means that time is decreased when they are exposed to sunlight, giving them less time to grow.

settings.question: Will Aeration help with pond smell?
settings.answer: The main cause of foul pond smell is usually because it lacks water aeration, if your pond has a rotten egg smell this is very likely caused by a buildup of hydrogen sulfide gas. It is usually an early indication that there is an imbalance in the pond ecosystem. An aerator will oxygenate and circulate the water reducing the foul odors greatly.

settings.question: How do I reduce mosquitoes by my pond?
settings.answer: As mosquitoes need still water to breed and lay their eggs a pond is the ideal breeding ground for them. An aerator is a natural solution for mosquito control by creating a constant flow of water in a pond, the mosquitoes are not able to breed. A secondary benefit of the aerator in this aspect is that oxygenated water will help your fish to thrive and produce more fish to eat any larvae still present on the water surface.

settings.question: How to remove sediment at the bottom of your pond?
settings.answer: When oxygen levels are low organic matter takes longer to decompose this accumulation of bottom sediment in your pond will result in it having to be dredged. The circulation and oxygenation provided by proper aeration will reduce this accumulation of sediment by allowing it to decompose faster. This should prolong or prevent a need for dredging your pond.

settings.video_desc:
Pond Dye not only makes your pond water look beautiful, but it also provides many benefits for
your pond’s ecosystem! Below we have questions past customers have asked and blogs
regarding the use of pond dye.

settings.question: Will TruBlue pond dye hurt my fish?
settings.answer: Our pond dye is guaranteed safe and non-toxic. It is safe for fish and actually can help your fish greatly.

settings.question: How much pond dye do I need for my pond?
settings.answer: 1 Quart colors up to 1 acre of pond.

settings.question: Will pond dye help brown water?
settings.answer: Yes! It really beautifies your pond by giving it a photogenic blue color.

settings.question: What are the benefits of pond dye?
settings.answer: It shades your pond and helps protect your fish from the sun during hot summers. It also protects your fish from predators like birds and others.

settings.question: What are the differences between Aqua Blue and Midnight Blue?
settings.answer: Aqua blue is more similar to the color of ocean water, while midnight blue is a darker shade of blue.
